intro: Cephaelis nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan celandine, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stem, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cephaelis nicaraguensis is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local herbal remedies.
